Diamond_Bar.Rancho Rincon de la Brea: Rancho Rincón de la Brea (also called "Rancho Cañada de la Brea") was a 4,452-acre (18.02 km2) Mexican land grant in present day Los Angeles County, California given in 1841 by Governor Juan Alvarado to Gil Maria Ybarra. The name means "Tar Gully Ranch" in Spanish. The one square league grant extended southward from San Jose Creek into the hills of Brea Canyon.
